description:
Join us on FRIDAY, JUNE 24 (6 - 9PM) for 'A DIGITAL TAKE OVER OF THE ANN ARBOR ART CENTER'

Free and open to the public.

Our first POP•IN of the year highlights processes and products of electric and electronic arts, featuring:

MUSIC PERFORMANCES:
- The.Black.Opera. a multimedia rap performance group with creative roots from Nigeria, Uganda, Madagascar, France and the United States.  They have toured extensively in Europe and the USA.

- Efflux a project intended as a structure for interdisciplinary improvisation.  It encompasses algorithms that react to sounds of percussion and electronic instruments.  This is a project of Simon Alexander-Adam (digital visual artist/musician) and Jon Taylor (percussionist.)

- Live DJ music from Scout, LIVE Nightclub's Saturday night resident.

AN INTERACTIVE PLAY STATION:
Featuring tech tools from the Ann Arbor District Library such as the gesture-operated Theremini, glowing Bliptronic, synthesizers, beat machines, and effects pedals.

DIGITAL ART MAKING STATIONS:
Featuring the tools of the Art Center's ARTLab, which combines traditional art and digital technologies. Pop-up workstations will allow visitors to try animation, claymation, and digital drawing.

IMMERSIVE THEATER PERFORMANCE:
-Featuring Kickshaw Theatre's production, Technology, In the Flesh.
Devised by Angela Dawe, Aral Gribble, and Lynn Lammers, 
laugh out loud in this playful 15-minute immersive performance. Tickets will be $8 at the event for the performance, that follows the journey of a scientist experimenting with digital and analog stimuli of human humor.
----------
POP•IN- Injecting the Art Center with a spirit of pop-up culture and by collaborating with diverse artists, we aim to attract intrepid young adults looking to explore and be excited by a city. 

Community members who attend POP•IN will be immersed in unusual, accessible experiences, whether they planned to attend the event or wandered in off the street.

While POP•IN is free, we will allow visitors to buy tickets to reserve seating for performances, and make things they can take home.

POP·OFF: POP·IN's official after party.

ALL ATTENDEES receive coupons for discounts and freebies at several participating bars/restaurants within a block of the Art Center.

Official page: http://www.annarborartcenter.org/events/popin/
-------------------
Sponsored by 
Michigan Council for Arts and Cultural Affairs & PNC

#POPIN
name: Pop•In

description:
Come join friends & neighbors alike for a fun, slow, community bike ride through Ann Arbor.

The fun starts at the Ann Arbor Farmers Market and will continue at a leisurly pace around town, where we will "bike-in" to Top of the Park (https://goo.gl/maps/zSwW1vsk9X32) for some post-ride music, dancing, food, drink, & fun.

That night on the Rackham Stage PanaMO and Orquesta RITMO are playing. There will also be salsa lessons. For more information about the festival go to http://a2sf.org/

Meet up time is 7:00 PM (departing 7:15 PM). Plan on a nice & easy route, 10 miles or less, within city limits. Check back later this week for route & other details to come. Until then, ride safe, be friendly, and have fun!


What's Bike-in?
See the community page:
https://www.facebook.com/bikeinannarbor/info?tab=page_info

OR read below

Bike-in is: Slow bike rides throughout Ann Arbor for everyone. Post-ride fun with friends, neighbors, and visitors around the community.

Each ride we will begin at the listed location & time, ride casually, then finish the ride by "biking-in" to a post-ride time together at a local establishment, green space, or other friendly host setting (i.e. Bike-in :: Movie (outdoor), Creamery (ice cream), Picnic (potluck), Garden (beer garden), etc.).

Rides will be open and friendly to all. For gathering information, times, locations, riding routes, weather updates, etc. like/follow the page or visit for updates.

Please practice safe riding and abide by all legal riding rules at all times, especially while riding with a Bike-in community. Be sure to provide your own helmet, riding lights, and other appropriate accessories.
name: Bike-in :: Top of the Park

description:
8-Bit Above is back!!!

Nikola Whallon 

Nikola takes a break from coding for the greater good of Particle Physics and LIVING in FRANCE, to visit friends and play his hometown of Ann Arbor! Chiptune and live instrumentation 

http://soundcloud.com/nikola-whallon

Watabou 

Chipbreak/Nintendocore/breakcore/GABBER artist takes a short break from his hiatis to play with friends. Travis will not be working or doing homework for at least a few hours, this is special!

http://soundcloud.com/watabou

Vest And Tyler
The newest addition to Chiptune in this area! Ann arbor chiptune dance music to the max!

Catears

Visuals by Walk in Circles!
name: 8-Bit Above w/ Nikola Whallon Watabou Catears Vest And Tyler

description:
House | EDM | Trap | Twerk | Electro
music by KEVIN MICHAEL

Kevin Michael, aka Kevin Kerber aka The Dangling Participle has been started from the bottom and now he’s here. From rocking stages to rocking chairs, Kevin Michael has always been a bastion of excellence in music, arts, culture, and oxford commas. His frenetic, open-format style of mixing has been described as, “pop-meets-electro-meets-slow-cooker.” This Ann Arbor based DJ is in it to win it. On his off time, Kevin Michael can be found lifting weights, eating mammies, not reading directions, and sardonically pontificating on miscellaneous etcetera. If you’re looking for the same old DJ, swipe left.
name: Festival Friday

description:
This park along the river has lots of great ecological diversity, including restored prairie and oak savanna. Help is needed to protect it from invasive weeds that crowd out natives and  maintaining the Native Garden at this park. The Garden is a living demonstration of the beauty of native wildflowers, both a help for identification and an example of how they can be used in landscaping. Please meet in the parking lot off of Fuller Road.
Please wear long pants and closed-toe shoes. All minors must present a completed release form, and should be accompanied by a guardian. Tools, snacks and know-how are provided. Free.
name: Furstenberg Park Stewardship Workday

description:
Sat. June 25 | 9:30pm | 18+ | $10 Cover

Super Happy Funtime Burlesque is a 12 member touring monstrosity. A live band, a burlesque troupe, a circus act, that is all together too contemporary, too modern, too bawdy, and too controversial to be defined just as “burlesque”. So, calling itself ‘burlesque’ for lack of a better term, SHFB is heading out for their 7th national tour this fall with its newest musical production. Designed to find your line and cross it, some kind of strange mix of GWAR and Benny Goodman with touches of SNL and the Price is Right, SHFB sprays you with glitter and love while playfully degrading taboo subjects like religion, politics, and sex. “For every 100 people dancing, there are usually ten or so walking out the door,” says host and bandleader Mr. Happypants, “You either get it or you don’t; the right people get it.” SHFB sets itself apart from other burlesque shows, and touring acts in general, for one major reason: its live band playing original music. Somewhere in a middle ground between Frank Zappa and Tom Waits, this show that gets curiosity seekers out with the promise of tits keeps them in the seats with a set of original tunes that get stuck in your head for weeks after the performance. “People are surprised by the songwriting! What they don’t know is that we’re all professional artists who’s day jobs are in the musical theater world, we bring that aesthetic and blend it with an underground edginess that leaves peoples jaws on the floor.” SHFB is presenting a new and contemporary musical theater at its finest. Come see it now before it gets so big that you can’t afford the ticket!!
name: Super Happy Funtime Burlesque 6/25/16 at Blind Pig - Ann Arbor
